Subclass.Name: Hangman's fracture
Prevalence: cervical fractures in patients with head injury

Subclass.Name: Compression fractures
Signs: Loss of height of the vertebra

Subclass.Name: Burst fracture
Subclass.Definition: High-energy vertebral fracture with shards penetrating surrounding tissue

Subclass.Name: Colles' fracture
Subclass.Definition: Fracture in which the distal radius is bent dorsally

Subclass.Name: Smith's fracture
Subclass.Definition: Fracture in which the distal radius is bnt volarly

Subclass.Name: Barton's fracture
Subclass.Definition: Fracture of the distal radius involving the articular rim

Informal: Hitting an object with a closed fist

Subclass.Name: Rolando fracture
Subclass.Definition: Intra-articular fracture of the base of the thumb

Subclass.Name: Bennett's fracture
Subclass.Definition: Intra-articular fracture of the base of the thumb involving a (sub)luxation thereof

Informal: Hitting an object with a closed fist

Subclass.Name: Gamekeeper's thumb
Subclass.Definition: Rupture of the ulnar collateral ligament accompanied by an avulsion fraction of the proximal phalanx of the thumb

Informal: Holding an object from the thumb
Falling with an outstretched hand on a pole

Subclass.Name: Diffuse axonal injury
Subclass.Definition: Scattered lesions over a widespread area of white and gray matter

Subclass.Name: Subdural hematoma
Subclass.Definition: Haemorrhage of the veins causing hematoma between the dura mater and the arachnoid mater

Subclass.Name: Epidural hematoma
Subclass.Definition: Arterial haemorrhage causing hematoma between the skull and the dura mater, causing patients to faint, wake up and faint again

Subclass.Name: Subarachnoid hematoma
Subclass.Definition: Haemorrhage of the area between the arachnoid membrane and the pia mater

Subtypes.Name: Premature atrial contractions
Subtypes.Pathophysiology: Earlier depolarisation by a different part of the atria than the SA node

Subtypes.Name: Left bundle branch block
Subtypes.Pathophysiology: Delayed depolarisation of the left ventricle
Signs: Deep and wide QRS-complexes in the precordial leads

Subtypes.Name: Right bundle branch block
Subtypes.Pathophysiology: Delayed depolarisation of the right ventricle

Subclass.Name: High anion gap metabolic acidosis
Etiology: Infection, iron, isoniazid, inborn errors of metabolism

Subtypes.Name: Acute respiratory acidosis
Subtypes.Definition: An acidosis in which both the pH as well as the pCO2 are elevated

Subtypes.Name: Chronic respiratory acidosis
Subtypes.Definition: An acidosis in which the pH is normal but hypercapnia is present
Subtypes.Pathophysiology: Hypercapnia due to hypoventilation, corrected by the kidneys

Subtypes.Name: Chloride-responsive metabolic alkalosis
Subtypes.Definition: An alkalosis with a urine chloride of <25 mEq/L

Subtypes.Name: Chloride-resistant metabolic alkalosis
Subtypes.Definition: An alkalosis with a urine chloride of >25 mEq/L

Subtypes.Name: Ischemic stroke
Subtypes.Definition: Interruption of the blood supply to the brain

Subtypes.Name: Transient ischaemic attack
Subtypes.Definition: Interruption of the blood supply to the brain lasting less than 2 hours

Subtypes.Name: Midbrain stroke syndrome
Subtypes.Pathophysiology: Occlusion of the posterior cerebral artery

Subclass.Name: Myocardial infarction
Symptoms: Radiating pain to right arm and shoulder

Subclass.Name: ST-elevation myocardial infarction
Subclass.Definition: Complete blockage of a coronary artery resulting in necrosis in part of the heart muscle

Subclass.Name: Non-ST elevation myocardial infarction
Subclass.Definition: Incomplete blockage of a coronary artery resulting in partial necrosis

Subclass.Name: Diverticulitis
Definition: Inflammations of abnormal diverticula in the large bowel

Subclass.Name: Appendicitis
Subclass.Pathophysiology: Primary obstruction of the appendix by bezoars or fecaliths, leading to stasis of mucus

Subtypes.Name: Cholesterol stones
Pathophysiology: Buildup of excess cholesterol in the bile
